dublin_core.dcvalue: Mobile telephone systems using radio waves with very low power outputs rarely interfere with electronic medical equipment which allows them to be safely installed in hospitals The Personal Handy phone System PHS which was developed and is widely used in Japan is one such system It has many useful functions including voice communication string message transfer e mail an answering system limited to selected persons or groups paging automatic call transfer and handset positioning In this paper we discuss the benefits of these functions confer to hospital communication systems
Advantages of low output mobile communication systems in hospitals.
